title: Longtime Jacksonville maritime museum closes
text:
Lack of funds, attendance cause longtime Jacksonville maritime museum to close its doors 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 10/19/15 4:01 am EDT - Updated: 10/19/15 4:01 am EDT 
JACKSONVILLE, Florida â€” The Jacksonville Maritime Heritage Center has closed after 28 years due to lack of attendance and financial support. 
The Florida Times-Union reports ( http://bit.ly/1MO9ub7 ) that the museum closed its doors for good on Sunday. Among the museum's features were a 15-foot-long model of the USS Saratoga aircraft carrier and an exhibit about the Titanic. 
Museum Director Paul Ghiotto says that arrangements are being made to donate most exhibits to museums and historical societies. 
It took about $45,000 to pay the annual bills for the 7,500-square-foot facility. Ghiotto says about $1,000 a month from donations, 75 paid memberships and money from the gift shop was not enough to keep the museum up and running. The museum opened in 1987. 
Ghiotto says the chance to educate people was well worth the effort. 
Information from: The (Jacksonville) Florida Times-Union, http://www.jacksonville.com
